Class IntImage

Kernel ANSI C IntImage routines, last updated 7/15/2002. More...

IntImage C only
 Kernel ANSI C only routines, last updated 12/5/1999.


Data Structures

struct  TIntImage
 An image containing pixels of type INT16. More...


Functions

void kI_EmptyImage (TIntImage *pInfo)
 Deletes all allocated memory for image, origo reset to (0,0), sets values in pInfo to zero and all pointers to NULL.

void kI_InitImage (TIntImage *pInfo)
 Sets all the pointers in pInfo to NULL, Origin to EMPTY and origo to (0,0).

bool kI_Load (const char *FileName, TIntImage *pInfo)
 Loads given file into "pInfo", all previous information in pInfo is destroyed.

bool kI_Save (const char *FileName, TIntImage *pInfo)
 Saves given file to disc, the file name must comply with the same rules as in kI_Load.

bool kI_SetBorder (UINT16 Size, INT16 Color, TIntImage *pInfo)
 Sets a border around image of size "Size", initialised to "Color".

bool kI_SetBorderSize (UINT16 Size, TIntImage *pInfo)
 Sets a border around image of size "Size", not initialised.

bool kI_SetBorderColor (INT16 Color, TIntImage *pInfo)
 Sets the color of the border.

bool kI_SetPeriodicBorder (unsigned short BorderSize, TIntImage *pInfo)
 Expands the image periodically in the border of size BorderSize.

 adds Bias to all pixels.

 Draws a line in image using the graphics routine k_GraphicsGenerateLine().

Detailed Description

Kernel ANSI C IntImage routines, last updated 7/15/2002.

Basic image functions for pixels of type float, to be used as stand alone c functions, also used by the IPL98 C++ library. The functions works on the TIntImage structure. These functions are part of the Image Processing Library IPL98.

Version:
1.42
Author:
René Dencker Eriksen edr@mip.sdu.dk (except for arithmetic and kI_CopyDisplace methods) Ivar Balslev ivb@mip.sdu.dk (arithmetic and kI_CopyDisplace)

Function Documentation

bool kI_Add (  TIntImage *    pImg,
TIntImage *    pAddend
) 
 

calulates the sum of two TIntImages.

The border (if present) is not affected. Adds to the history.

Parameters:
pAddend  is a pointer to the image of type TIntImage to be added
pImg  is a pointer to the source-destination image of type TIntImage
Returns :
False if one or both of the images involved are empty or have different size
Version:
0.80
Author:
Implemented by Ivar Balslev (ivb@mip.sdu.dk)

bool kI_AllocImage (  UINT32    Width,
UINT32    Height,
TIntImage *    pInfo
) 
 

Initialises a new image with given dimensions.

All pixel colors are initialised to 0. Sets Origin to "RAM", origo to (0,0), size of border to 0 and clears the history.

Parameters:
Width  The width of image in pixels.
Height  The height of image in pixels.
Returns :
false, if pInfo is a NULL pointer.
See also:
kI_AllocImageFast

bool kI_ApplyBias (  INT16    Bias,
TIntImage *    pImg
) 
 

adds Bias to all pixels.

pSource may be equal to pDest. The border (if present) is not affected. Adds to the history.

Parameters:
pImg  is a pointer to the source-target image of type TIntImage
Bias  is the bias value
Returns :
False if *pImg is empty

bool kI_CopyDisplace (  int    dx,
int    dy,
TIntImage *    pImg
) 
 

performs a displacement so that (dx,dy) in the old picture becomes (0,0).

Periodic continuation is assumed. The border (if present) is not affected. Adds to the history.

Parameters:
pImg  is a pointer to the source image
dx  is the horizontal displacement
dy  is the vertical displacement
Returns :
False if *pImg is empty
Version:
0.80
Author:
Implemented by Ivar Balslev (ivb@mip.sdu.dk)

bool kI_CopyFromByte (  TIntImage *    pDest,
TImage *    pSource
) 
 

copies a TImage into an TIntImage.

*pDest attains the same dimensions as the *pSource. History from *pSource is copied to *pDest, old history in *pDest is deleted.

Parameters:
pSource  a pointer to the source image
pDest  a pointer to the destination image
Returns :
False if source image is empty
Version:
0.80
Author:
Implemented by Ivar Balslev (ivb@mip.sdu.dk)

bool kI_CopyFromComplex (  COMPLEXCHOISE    mode,
TIntImage *    pDest,
TComplexImage *    pSource
) 
 

copies partially a TComplexImage into a TIntImage.

pDest attains the same dimensions as *PSource, and mode determines which part of the source image is copied. Note that this is a straight forward convertion, values are truncated directly to the destination range. For more advanced convertions look at the functions available in local operation . History from *pSource is copied to *pDest, old history in *pDest is deleted.

Parameters:
mode  Determines what part of the complex image is to be copied. The values are COMPLEX_REAL, COMPLEX_IMAGINARY, or COMPLEX_MODULUS.
pDest  a pointer to the destination image
pSource  a pointer to the source image
Returns :
False if source image is empty
Version:
0.80
Author:
Implemented by Ivar Balslev (ivb@mip.sdu.dk)

Definition at line 1229 of file i_kernel_functions.c.

TFloatImage *    pSource
) 
 

copies a TFloatImage into a TIntImage.

*pDest attains the same dimensions as the *pSource. Note that this is a straight forward convertion, values are truncated directly to the destination range. For more advanced convertions look at the functions available in local operation . History from *pSource is copied to *pDest, old history in *pDest is deleted.

Parameters:
pSource  a pointer to the source image
pDest  a pointer to the destination image
Returns :
False if source image is empty

bool kI_CopyImage (  TIntImage *    pDest,
const TIntImage *    pSource
) 
 

Copies whole image from "pSource" to "pDest".

All information is copied to the destination image including border pixels, palette and history. Previous data in "pDest" are destroyed, including the old history. Origin is set to RAM. File information is left empty.

Returns :
False, if source and destination image is the same.

bool kI_CopySubImage (  int    xmin,
int    ymin,
int    xmax,
int    ymax,
TIntImage *    pDest,
const TIntImage *    pSource
) 
 

Copies rectangel from "pSource" to "pDest".

Starting from (xmin,ymin) (including min values) and ending at (xmax,ymax) (excluding max values). Previous data in "pDest" are destroyed. Origin is set to RAM. Adds to the history.

Returns :
false if rectangel is outside dimensions of source image or if source image is empty.

bool kI_CutOrZeroPad (  TIntImage *    Dest,
TIntImage *    pSource
) 
 

copies an image into another of different size without scaling.

The origin is retained. For increasing width/height, zero padding is applied. Simple cuts are applied for reduced width/height. The border (if present) is not affected. Adds to the history.

Parameters:
pSource  is a pointer to the source image
pDest  must be allocated prior to calling
Returns :
False if *pSource and/or *pDest are empty
Version:
0.80
Author:
Implemented by Ivar Balslev (ivb@mip.sdu.dk)

void kI_EmptyImage (  TIntImage *    pInfo ) 
 

Deletes all allocated memory for image, origo reset to (0,0), sets values in pInfo to zero and all pointers to NULL.

All structures inside TIntImage is emptied with their corresponding empty-function. Origin is set to "EMPTY", The history is cleared.

void kI_InitImage (  TIntImage *    pInfo ) 
 

Sets all the pointers in pInfo to NULL, Origin to EMPTY and origo to (0,0).

All structures inside TImage is initialised with their corresponding init-function. Allways call this function when creating a new TIntImage variable.

Definition at line 70 of file i_kernel_functions.c.

bool kI_Load (  const char *    PathAndFileName,
TIntImage *    pInfo
) 
 

Loads given file into "pInfo", all previous information in pInfo is destroyed.

The file name must include a relative or absolut path and the name of the file with extension, both characters '/' and '\' can be used to seperate folder names (remember to "escape" the character '\', ex. "c:\\test.bmp"). The type of the file is determined by the given extension. Origin is set to "DISC". Adds to the history.

Parameters:
PathAndFileName  Filename (including the path) to be loaded.
Returns :
False if the syntacs of PathAndFileName is wrong, the file is not found or the format of the file is wrong.

Definition at line 192 of file i_kernel_functions.c.

bool kI_Multiply (  TIntImage *    pImg,
TIntImage *    pFactor
) 
 

calculates product of two images The border (if present) is not affected.

Adds to the history.

Parameters:
pFactor  a pointer to the image of type TIntImage to be multiplied
pImg  is a pointer to the source-destination image of type TIntImage
Returns :
False if one or both of the images involved are empty or have different size

)

bool kI_Save (  const char *    PathAndFileName,

) 
 

Saves given file to disc, the file name must comply with the same rules as in kI_Load.

Adds to the history.

PathAndFileName  Filename (including the path) to be loaded.
Returns :

bool kI_ScaleIntensity (  float    Prefactor,
TIntImage *    pImg
) 
 

scales the integer colors using a constant multiplier.

The border (if present) is not affected. Adds to the history.

Parameters:
pImg  is a pointer to the source-target image of type TIntImage
Prefactor  is the scaling factor
Returns :
False if *pImg is empty
Version:
0.80
Author:
Implemented by Ivar Balslev (ivb@mip.sdu.dk)

INT16    Color,
TIntImage *    pInfo
) 
 

Sets a border around image of size "Size", initialised to "Color".

Parameters:
Size  Size of border in pixels to be added in each direction.

bool kI_SetPeriodicBorder (  unsigned short    BorderSize,
TIntImage *    pInfo
) 
 

Expands the image periodically in the border of size BorderSize.

If a border of size BorderSize is present in pInfo it is used, otherwise a new border of BorderSize is created.

Parameters:
BorderSize  Size of border to copy image periodically to.
Returns :
false if BorderSize is bigger than either width or height of pInfo.

bool kI_Subtract (  TIntImage *    pImg,
TIntImage *    pSubtrahend
) 
 

calulates the difference of two TIntImages.

The border (if present) is not affected. Adds to the history.

Parameters:
pSubtrahend  is a pointer to the image of type TIntImage to be subtracted
pImg  is a pointer to the source-destination image of type TIntImage
Returns :
False if one or both of the images involved are empty or have different size
Version:
0.80
Author:
Implemented by Ivar Balslev (ivb@mip.sdu.dk)
